sentences.cn: “干得太棒了，”克劳德钦佩地说。

sentences.en: Charles displays unreserved admiration for his grandfather.
sentences.cn: 查尔斯从不掩饰他对祖父的景仰。

sentences.en: Daniel gazed at her in admiration .
sentences.cn: 丹尼尔用爱慕的眼神注视着她。

sentences.en: He ducked his head to hide his admiration.
sentences.cn: 他低下头以掩饰他的仰慕之情。

sentences.en: He was extravagant in his admiration of Hellas.
He won admiration for his forensic skills in cross-examining ministers.
sentences.cn: 他在盘问几位部长时表现出的问案技巧为他赢得了赞赏。

sentences.en: Her athleticism drew the admiration of the crowd.
sentences.cn: 她的运动才能令众人赞叹不已。

sentences.en: His breadth of knowledge filled me with admiration.
sentences.cn: 他学识渊博，令我非常钦佩。

sentences.en: His tough stand won some grudging admiration.
sentences.cn: 他的强硬态度使得一些对他不满的人也不由得感到钦佩。

sentences.en: I couldn't repress a sigh of admiration.
sentences.cn: 我忍不住发出一声赞叹。

sentences.en: I had a deep admiration for Sartre.
sentences.cn: 我对萨特怀有深深的敬意。

sentences.en: I think that's earned him very high admiration.
sentences.cn: 我认为那一点为他赢得了极高的赞誉。
梅格羡慕地睁大了双眼。

sentences.en: She is full of admiration for the head and teachers.
sentences.cn: 她对校长和教师们满心钦佩。

sentences.en: She was caught between envy and admiration.
sentences.cn: 她不知是该妒忌还是该羡慕。

sentences.en: The paintings she produced in those months won undivided admiration.
sentences.cn: 她那几个月里创作的画作备受推崇。

words.tran_cn: 令人钦佩的；极好的；值得赞扬的
受人钦佩的；感到羡慕的
美好地，极好地；令人钦佩地
羡慕，赞美；钦佩（admire的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a feeling of great respect and liking for something or someone
